intro: Synadenium gazense, commonly known as the African crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers with a crown-like structure. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance. Synadenium gazense is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil and full sun.
